intro: Corydalis cristata, commonly known as the crested larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its striking, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to purple, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has fern-like, bipinnate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Corydalis cristata grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes other well-known genera such as poppies andeland.
